title:Pandapaxxy's Heresy Vendor Weapon Breakdown
description:Based on https://www.reddit.com/r/sharditkeepit/comments/1j4yz4u/heresy_vendor_weapon_breakdown/

// Redrix's Estoc
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Redrix’s Estoc is not only a tongue twister but a decently strong pulse rifle. If you liked the BXR-55 Battler then this will feel right at home. If you wanted Stasis synergy, Rimestealer and Headstone are where it's at. If you don't, that's okay, the stats alone make up for it. Redrix's Estoc will be the Battler on steroids. Desperate Measures is great for having a rolling damage bonus. But the lack of a reload perk outside of Perpetual Motion is kind of weaksauce." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=3218364298&perks=839105230,1087426260,1428297954,2109543898

// Redrix's Estoc
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Where Redrix's Estoc really gets to shine is of course in PvP. Lone Wolf, Zen Moment, and Rapid Hit all bump up the already high feel and stats for this weapon. And you can even delete a guardian in 5c1b with Sword Logic after a kill. Without stocks the pulse is already in a league of its own." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,controller
dimwishlist:item=3218364298&perks=839105230,3142289711,2387244414,31345821

// Resounding
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Well it's kind of like if Null Composure had a worse off baby. Subsistence is nice as is Reservoir Burst. But a reload speed masterwork kinda hurts. Add in on top of that it's an Aggressive Frame and it's just easy enhancement shards." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=1824586582&perks=1482024992,3868766766,1820235745,831391274
dimwishlist:item=1824586582&perks=1482024992,3868766766,1820235745,1427256713
dimwishlist:item=1824586582&perks=1482024992,3868766766,1799762209,831391274
dimwishlist:item=1824586582&perks=1482024992,3868766766,1799762209,1427256713

// Resounding
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "There's nothing too good for PvP in either column, which is super weird for Bungie’s ritual philosophy. Cornered puts you in a bad position and Hatchling only does significant damage with a fragment." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=1824586582&perks=1482024992,3868766766,1820235745,831391274
dimwishlist:item=1824586582&perks=1482024992,3868766766,1820235745,1427256713
dimwishlist:item=1824586582&perks=1482024992,3868766766,1799762209,831391274
dimwishlist:item=1824586582&perks=1482024992,3868766766,1799762209,1427256713

// Backfang
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Backfang is an interesting glaive. It gives the rapid-fire frame some more love outside of a raid or dungeon. Impulse Amplifier helps that lower range and boosts reload. You can also pair this with the excellent add clearing utility of Voltshot. Do note that Grave Robber doesn't proc Voltshot but will help with Desperate Measures. The standard glaive perks will always apply but your usage might be better with some builds than others." Recommended MW: Shield Duration.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=267672635&perks=580685494,1087426260,951095735,2173046394

// Backfang
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Glaives are not meta in PvP. Rapid-fire glaives even less so. Impulse Amplifier will help make sure your precious shots hit and Unstoppable Force will make those shots do more damage. If you fully invest into blocking you could go for Tilting at Windmills or Replenishing Aegis. Close to Melee also works phenomenally if you can secure the kill with the glaive. But as always with these weapons, they're not for the faint of heart." Recommended MW: Range or Shield Duration.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Joxer's Longsword
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "You've got so many options for spreading Weaken or Volatile with Joxer’s Longsword. Destabilizing Rounds is my choice because it spreads easily and has a shorter cooldown. Easy choice for killing trash mobs. Withering Gaze is nice for juicier targets like champions. And the newest perk Demoralize is just so incredible. Spreading Weaken on precision kills is just so easy. It also has a dope name so we can't pass that up." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Joxer's Longsword
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Heavy burst pulses haven't been ultra meta outside of a few specific player's hands. Lone Wolf is an easy pick for boosting stats passively and doubling when alone. Headseeker provides some forgiveness if you miss and Gutshot Straight boosts just the body shot damage, pushing total damage even further." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pvp,controller

// Joxer's Longsword
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB): "Heavy burst pulses haven't been ultra meta outside of a few specific player's hands. Lone Wolf is an easy pick for boosting stats passively and doubling when alone. Headseeker provides some forgiveness if you miss and Gutshot Straight boosts just the body shot damage, pushing total damage even further." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb

// Cynosure
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "It's like Bungie wants us to replace Hothead but Hothead just looks better. If you missed Hothead then Cynosure is alright and comes with competitive perks. Reconstruction, Field Prep and Clown Cartridge are your bread and butter, but perks like Overflow, Ambitious Assassin, and even Demolitionist are all great too. Pair that with Explosive Light or High Ground for more damage or Bipod for even more rockets and you might never need to reload." Recommended MW: Blast Radius.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Cynosure
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Cynosure exists like all heavy weapons do in PvP. Placeholders for the one time you pick up heavy every 7 games. Tracking Module will help you land your one rocket, and things like Chain Reaction or Cluster Bomb will possibly net you more than one kill. But let's be honest, heavies in PvP are usually hit or miss (*zing*!)" Recommended MW: Blast Radius.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller
